Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bvonr
Reviews.Content: Tried using a hotel coupon during Spring Break but that was a no go, but they were willing to negociate a good price. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was OK but had to take it back to the room as there is no tables and chairs. It is very close to Old Town and tourist places. Thanks IDA and ROSE

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jordenlane
Reviews.Content: the location was great for this hotel, great price, free parking. This is our second Vagabond hotel to stay at in the SD area. the room was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast (boxed cereal, waffles, boiled eggs, fruit, coffee,juice) was good - nothing fancy, but good. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but it was clean, relatively quiet, relatively inexpensive, and very convenient to the zoo and other sites. The breakfast bar is nothing fancy and you have to take everything back to the room to eat it, but it was free and did include waffles if you were so inclined. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yossarian13
Reviews.Content: Better beds than the Houston galleria Marriott. I stayed there 2nights before coming here so it's a truthful benchmark. Value for money, big time!

Reviews.Title: “deceiving computer pictures”
Reviews.Author: jenie l
Reviews.Content: prev. stay md me book for gransons family. no area to eat in and they had already ckd out to go to zoo. stated must hv remodeled one rm for computer pictures. reg rm was nothing like it . big disappointment. will nvr recommend again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, great staff and awesome value.”
Reviews.Author: timetotravelboston
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my two teens after they had their wisdom teeth extracted. No one wanted to share a bed so we asked for a roll-away. That had an additional cost of $20 per night. For $30 more we were offered a room with three queen size beds! We ended up with a $100 room where we were all comfortable plus breakfast. The ridiculously large TV was a bit much for us, but I am sure many families would love it. Vagabond is a budget motel. But the staff and amenities made it one of the best values we have had.

Reviews.Title: “Check out at the desk, don't just leave.”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne G
Reviews.Content: I booked one night on PL nearly 4 months in advance. I called to immediately request two beds and was rudely told I would have to upgrade to the price for a room with two beds. As that price was about $60 more than my PL bid, I declined. Upon arrival, the desk clerk was much nicer in person. I asked for a room with two beds instead of the king bed room, and he said it would be a $15 charge, to which I agreed. The room was spacious, and quiet with a location at the back of the building and upstairs. The frig appeared to be plugged in, but it never did seem to turn on and get cold despite my efforts. The room is a bit aged, but seemed fairly clean. I would stay here again for sure, however, I will never leave without finalizing my bill at the front desk. I just left, and later discovered I was charged an additional $22.50 for having a two-bed room. I would stay here again at a PL price, but I will never book it at their prices because I feel deceived. This was not my first stay; I've been here about 5 times but this was my first dishonest transaction with them.

Reviews.Title: “4 NIGHT STAY, FEB 2012”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine R
Reviews.Content: Overall, I agree with the 4 star rating. Price, value, location, cleanliness, waffle/cereal/oatmeal/frruit breakfast, amenities, etc. Shower was a little tricky and I had to call for missing items a couple of times, but they were brought quickly. I bumped to 5 stars because of what happened on the 23rd of Feb. Going to tour San Diego all day, put the electronics including the iPad in the safe and off we went. Returned after dinner and went to get the iPad.. we had left the safe wide open! My heart sank. But there it was right where I left it, along with everything else! I was amazed. So, for honesty and trustworthiness, I give the Vagabond top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Ida & Crystal; the font desk Assistants, are friendly, agreeable, & promptly accommodating. Indeed they made my day.”
Reviews.Author: John Y
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, I was given options at the front desk despite my presumed "locked-in" reservation. I opted to assert my priorities and they were met beyond expectation; not only were my requests secured, but my room was upgraded for free as well. Clean, quiet, downstairs, freely upgraded. Total, $71 (including 7.750% tax in that area), however I did apply a AAA member discount. I cannot stress enough the enrichment of my stay on account of Ida and Crystal, they're professionals, and know how to please customers. I expect that quality of service from resorts costing >=$200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Allie G
Reviews.Content: Jayson at the front desk is awesome! I showed up with all my luggage after walking from another not-to-be mentioned hotel. I was exhausted and frustrated that the other hotel (where I'd had reservations for 3 weeks) had given me the wrong room. Jayson let me check out the room at Vagabond while I left my ID at the front desk to make sure it was acceptable before I booked it. It was VERY nice, especially for the price and location-- new granite counters, nice big TV, and most important, it was CLEAN. Plus, a CLEAN fridge and CLEAN microwave. Great place for a great price! And they should give Jayson a raise-- he's wonderful with customers (and I seriously looked like I'd been dragged off the streets when I walked in, but you'd never know it-- I still got the best possible treatment). Customer service is extremely hard work (I know, I used to work in hospitality), and he does it very well. Also, free breakfast, and I only paid about $15 more a night than the not-to-be mentioned place.

Reviews.Title: “Check out other choices”
Reviews.Author: cbgfree
Reviews.Content: My 2 day visit stay was black & white. First night, single bed room location horrid - highly frequented soda machine just outside door; Interstate noise continuous - added up to unrestful night. When I tried to check out next morning told I had reserved two nights (via their Internet site, not 3rd party) and would be charged for room whether I stayed or not. The alternative was to be moved to a different room. Made all the difference. Two bed room location was at back of site away from machines & Interstate plus much larger and had HDTV. First night room had an old, fuzzy TV. My advice if you choose this hotel with its ridiculous "can't change your mind" check out policy, book a two bed room because the price difference is worth the amenities including a table and chairs for eating. That's important because there is no central dining area; it's eat in your room. Breakfast is sparse compared to similar priced accommodations. Food choice is pretty much waffles or a piece of fruit. Hotel Row is home to all brands of hotels and a great location because it is the Interstate service road essentially; is located just across from a major shopping center with movie theater, restaurants (Cheesecake Factory is a stand out), etc; easy access to Interstate facilities getting to Things To Do. Do not miss the world class Zoo! It is a whole day outing so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: retireddl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Hotel Circle-South- in San Diego. Right next to the Marriott. This hotel, however, if much less money. Our double queen room was 59.00 a night. It is an older hotel, two story, but close to everything, and a very good price for the area. The hotel was very clean, and comfortable. It had a frig, microwave,of course, a TV. A bonus is they accept pets. It is $20.00 per night --a bit high,-- but many hotels charge more than that. The continental breakfast was OK considering the size of the hotel lobby-where it is served. It had waffles, the usual cereals, and the like. We would sure stay there again.....the Price is right and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_Bear_NZ
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel over the net for myself and 3 friends. In spite of the booking confirmation confirming the rate inclusive for 4 adults, they said the website wasnt correct and that they had to charge me extra amount. Hardly fair, for the amount I paid in the end, I could have stayed at a much nicer hotel. Not a fan of hotels that do this sort of thing, but never mind, they always get a suitable review. Room itself was basic but clean. As far as location goes, its miles from anywhere relevant (except the zoo).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value- well situated for Local buses if not driving”
Reviews.Author: sandijo
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, especially as it was the New Year. The Vagabond was well situated with bus stop just outside $5.00 day pass gets you on buses and trolleys just about anywhere in San Diego. Rooms where clean and staff were very helpful. Breakfast available in lobby, waffles etc as well as cofee making facilities in the room. Would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel near the zoo”
Reviews.Author: primroseLA
Reviews.Content: We were just looking for a convenient place to stay for one night within an easy drive of Balboa Park. This hotel is on a busy street filled with hotels and restaurants, but it was exactly what we (a family of 4) wanted -- clean, large, efficiently run, and a serve-yourself breakfast in the lobby with waffle machines! We were a little worried about street noise since our room was five doors down from the street, but the a/c/heating unit drowned out any noise and we all slept well. Would definitely stay here again. It also seemed convenient to Sea World, though it is a few miles inland.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: This motel exceeded our expectations! Hot waffle breakfast, clean remodeled rooms, and great laundry facilities. Easy to get to the highway and to attractions. Lots of food around.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful services”
Reviews.Author: betty c
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful experience and great service Mrs Betty Clinton

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gillamite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in October. This hotel and staff strive to make your stay memorable. Rooms are clean and big, didn't have a king ready when we checked in so upgraded to 2 queens. We have stayed here before and will in the future, good budget hotel close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: genamax
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Vagabond every time I visit San Diego. The staff really ensures a quality stay! The rooms are always clean and it's a very peaceful property.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: Per Chr E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Vagabond Inn two times, in January 2010 and October this year. We have met a very service minded front desk clerck, Ida, with the most winning smile. In October we stayed there for 6 days. The location was excellent for exploring San Diego. The room was very clean and quiet (we stayed away from the I-8). The waffel breakfast was very good (they did an experiment with a pancake machine the last day, but the waffels are much better). We would like to come back. UPC, Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: osfar s
Reviews.Content: At arrival, I was greeted by front desk clerk "Jayson" with a smile and a great attitude. After securing our reservation, he took the time to explain to me all the amenities that are included in the Jacuzzi package we reserved, and told us me about the quite tasty breakfast they served in the morning, and it was quite good. The jacuzzi room was incredible! 47'' Plasma t.v., king pillow-top mattress, 2 people whirlpool/spa with surround sound stereo in the bathroom! Amazing people, amazing place, we will most definitely be using their services in the future! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, But a Bit Noisy!"”
Reviews.Author: NDAshley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night last weekend. We were attending an event at the Crowne Plaza across the street (I mean freeway) so it was a perfect location for that. The Vagabond was a great deal for the price-- comfy bed, free parking, friendly desk clerks. The room was very clean and the bathtub and fixtures looked like they have been recently upgraded. Actually, it was way better than I expected it to be! They also have 2 pools. We didn't have a chance to swim but they looked very clean and well-kept as well! The free breakfast in the morning was great: donuts, waffles, fruit, etc. The one problem I had with the hotel was the noise. Even with the door closed we could hear the cars buzzing by on the freeway. Our room was towards the front of the property, and I can only imagine how noisy the rooms facing the freeway must be. I recommend requesting a room towards the back of the property. If you do that, you should have no problem with noise. We were only there for 1 night, so it wasn't that big of a deal. However, if I was going to stay for an extended vacation, it probably would have bugged me.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgrad07
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! I was happy with my stay, rooms were cleaned when I arrived and at one point I needed towels and they got there fast. I was very happy with the price I paid for the hotel room compared to the other places I could of stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our tour”
Reviews.Author: KGtourist
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at the hotel after our flight and it was eay to find just off the motorway. Our family room was great with lots of extra touches to make the stay more comfortable. Fantastic breakfast ( waffles, cereal, fruit, coffee etc) which could be eaten by the pools or in your room. The room and pool area were clean. We stayed in a number of hotels on our trip and this was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DerekFGuadalajara
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a shopping trip to San Diego; we live near Guadalajara,Mexico and took advantage of Volaris's low fares for the non-stop flight to San Diego. The Vagabond hotel on Hotel Circle South fitted in well with our plans as far as location was concderned.we found the staff tobe very friendly and the hotel clean and well looked after.It was busy when other were not,so others seemed to agree with our findings. By getting a room away from I-8,it was very quiet. Maybe the breakfast could have been better, but for the price, the overall deal was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly nightmare with freeway noise”
Reviews.Author: bengo4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the great reviews I read here, and maybe we got stuck with a dank, dark, stinky room because we were honest & said we had a pet. However, by coincidence, our next-door neighbors (with no pets) also stayed here at exactly the same time when we were all displaced due to tenting, and they hated their stay as well. They said they got virtually no sleep, due to freeway noise. While we had no freeway noise (we were on the east side of the south-east building), security was also an issue -- people roam from door to door to shove fast-food fliers under the door and to distribute doorknob-hangers for pizza delivery, and this is a motel-type setup, where people walk past your windows. Yes, the room was cheap, but for even one night, the experience was NOT worth the money we saved. (The only positives of the stay were the friendly front deskers and our morning waffles.) I did not feel our belongings would be safe in the room unattended, and this was the type of room where you would not want to walk barefoot on the carpet, and you wouldn't want your body to touch the bedspread. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vagabond”
Reviews.Author: billie m
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with condition of room (especially for the price). Very comfortable and convenient. Wanted to stay longer but no room availability. Paid more to stay at Best Western for one more night....SO NOT WORTH IT. Made me miss Vagabond even more! Absolutely loved making my own waffles in the morning. Ida and Rose were great!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - best suited for adult, short-stay”
Reviews.Author: kkwill29
Reviews.Content: Wanted a decently priced, short-stay lodging in a good location for our itinerary - Vagabond Inn satisfied all of these requirements. The room was well-priced, clean, newly furnished with a new window air conditioner, and in a great location (easily accessible to beaches, airport, and zoo). The front desk agent, Ida, was extremely attentive and helpful. We were given an upgrade from a queen to king bed, as requested upon our arrival, with no added charge. We also purchased discounted zoo tickets at the front desk. Continental breakfast was fine and coffee/tea were available all hours - nice touch. Frig, coffemaker, and microwave were in good condition. Our only complaint is that the room had a musty smell much of the night, despite running the AC. However, we did not complain/point this out to the front desk b/c we were there such a short time. Two swimming pools - both small but adequate. We didn't swim; but we did enjoy sitting at the tables, snacking and talking. The area is definitely not suited for walking and may not be much fun for children.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: rbgs
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel and it met all of our needs. The room was fairly basic, but the toiletries available were above usual motel standard (e.g. including conditioner, not just soap and shampoo). The location is average: in Hotel Circle with all the rest. There is not much within walking distance, but that's pretty typical of San Diego. As others have noted, breakfast items are set out in the lobby but there is nowhere to eat them. There are signs suggesting eating poolside, which we did. There are two pools, each with a few tables and chairs. Speaking of the pool, the pool was fine (though it did seem to attract a lot of bees!), but the promised towels were nowhere to be found. There are signs in the room threatening dire consequences if you use your room towels at poolside, so I had to walk, damp, back to my room after swimming. It was a warm day, so this wasn't a problem, but it also wasn't ideal. Checking in and out was quick and the staff were courteous. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Long Range Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: val2val
Reviews.Content: We usually stay around the corner from Point Loma but decided to give the Vagabond a try since it is in the same parking lot as our long range boat, The Red Rooster III. The rooms are very average but clean and adequate. The soap and shampoos are good and the coffee pot with coffee is also good. The morning breakfast buffet is very handy and tasty. There is a refrigerator and a microwave also. The pool is kept clean and is sheltered and fenced. There are several restaurants within walking distance and Fisherman's Seafood restaurant is only feet away. We will stay here again on our next fishing trip.

Reviews.Title: “will stay nowhere else”
Reviews.Author: kerry h
Reviews.Content: very cozy secluded feeling close to beaches zoo harbor shopping and great food and old town

Reviews.Title: “not the best deal in our trip”
Reviews.Author: marzinihw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in good positionl to visit san diego and don't want to stay in the city center, and room are quite clean and silent, but it was one of the most expensive we found in our 3 weeks trip and for sure it doesn't worth the price we paid.also in our reservation we had free room upgrade but there were no free upgradable room when we arrive there . The rooms are nice. We had two queen beds and they were actually very comfortable. Our room had a fridge, microwave, tv and powerful air conditioner. The rooms and the property were quiet enough. The room did have an odd smell but leaving the front door open for half an hour solved the problem. there were no breackfast room, so u have to go to the reception, pick it up and have it your room, and this is not good. The pool towels were quite old and consumed and there were no hairdryer in the room so we had to ask for one at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “NO PROBLEM GETTING MY ENDORSMENT”
Reviews.Author: 808Mahalo
Reviews.Content: Aloha, and thank you Vagabond Inn Hotel Circle, San Diego for a pleasant stay. The rooms were very clean, very tidy and comfortable. The grounds and buildings were well maintained. And the staff (Leo) and others that I met were very helpful, and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean & charming”
Reviews.Author: wendyjo98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. My daughter and I were visiting Sea World for the day and we knew we wouldn't want to be making the 2 hour trip back home that late at night. The night staff was very friendly, funny and courteous which made check-in nice after our long day. I was glad they expained where to find the main power switch in the room (which was not just inside the door as you would expect). While we booked one queen bed, we were pleased upon entering our room to see that they upgraded us to two queens. Nice surprise! Our room was very clean and spacious. The beds were very comfortable and we did not find the area noisy at all. (we stayed in Room 207) What we liked most was the charm of being able to park right outside our room. I miss the days of being able to do that, rather than have to park in some huge structure and feel like you have to walk a mile down many hallways just to get to your room. When we realized we had left something in the car, it was no big deal to just run downstairs in our pj's to retrieve the item. (ha ha) We did not get to try the breakfast as we slept in past breakfast serving time. This hotel will be our first choice upon our next overnight visit.

Reviews.Title: “Solid overall”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyG58
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the Hotel Circle Vagabond for a sub-$100 room: 2 very comfortable queens (felt well-rested; no aches or stiffness), nonsmoking, decent-sized TV, 2 pools, lobby breakfast, helpful & friendly staff. Easy-quick check-in, check-out. Clean, well-maintained pools, spa, & pool-area bathroom. Clean bedspread & linens, plenty of towels, etc. All ice machines in good working condition at all times of the day & night. Downstairs room very quiet 3 out of 4 nights. Only complaint: upstairs neighbors the last night of our stay. Twenty-something couple clomped & stomped from 8:30 p.m. to ?? making no effort to be quiet. Not malicious, just clueless. Gave up trying to sleep & hit the road at 3 a.m. Suggestions for travelers: request an upstairs room if you absolutely need a full night's uninterrupted sleep. Suggestions for front-desk employees: gently remind upstairs occupants that the floors are thin and to be considerate of downstairs neighbors. Walk on thin ice/tip-toe after 10 p.m. Suggestion for management: Hotel carpets are always an issue with me & many fellow travelers. Is cleaning/shampooing the carpets once a month realistic? Sure would be nice to have this reassurance. Most the time -- all hotels, not just Vagabond -- hotel carpets feel like some kind of gummy-bear composite fiber. Props to: All employees who worked between Sunday evening, 8-7-11 & Weds. early a.m. 8-11-11. Friendly, caring, competent especially Ida, Leo & Pooja on breakfasts and housekeeping staffer Monday & Tuesday early afternoons. Good-hearted, charming woman. Felt the warmth. We've stayed here roughly a half-dozen times. Can't beat the location & value. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: busymama1977
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, nicely decorated, and unbeatable price. The kids loved the pool and bunk bed! The next time we travel to SD, the Vagabond Inn is where we'll stay! One tip: If you are sensitive to noise while you sleep, bring ear plugs and/or request a room in the back of the property. The highway is very close, we slept with the a/c on to compensate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: YILDIZ S
Reviews.Content: Calm and quiet. Front Desk Staff are lovely. Many thanks to LEO. Great hospitality by the employees. Room was terriffic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service of Front Desk & Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: tonyachacoso
Reviews.Content: The entire week that we were in the hotel our room was well cleaned and kept. The front desk ( IDA & LEO ) were courteous and prompt enough in attending to our requests. Housekeeping (ROSE) was also very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and will come back”
Reviews.Author: AnneComents
Reviews.Content: Room is nice and clean. Towel and sheet are new and comfortable. Bothroom even is prepared with makeup remover, shower cap and mouth fresher. I also love the breakfast. The food is basic but well prepared, very fresh fruit, hot waffle, fresh boiled eggs, milk, full choices of cereals, teas and nice coffee. During the peak time, you may see people staying in line and just wait to get breakfast. I normally do not touch those 2 star hotels' breakfast. However, I had to have it each morning before I am gone for work. I stayed there one night the week before, then camce back there for another four nights. One thing is not great that there is no hairdryer in standard room. Althrough you may get one at the front desk. Not convenient. At that price, I strongly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, these rooms are low quality, Go down the street..”
Reviews.Author: 123dm
Reviews.Content: We reserved a King bed with a SOFA as we were planning to stay for 2 weeks. After the Manager sent us on a round the complex trip with keys to each room we asked for , None had a king with sofa. We decided to spend the evening as it was getting late, the carpet was soo Dirty when we showered more dirt was washed from our feet, we didn't even go outside and neither od=f us wore flip flops. The tv was so bad we couldn't see thru the lines. The room had an odor of musty, must have had MOLD in the walls as it seemed so humid in side, the AC couldn't dry the air out, it was only mid 70's outside, we didn't need the AC but thought it would help, It Didn't. The room clerk charged us 124 for the nite. These units would be your normal road kill motel rooms. worth 24.95. We ended our stay in the area at the Kings Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet - we would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: klynniec
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two room king suite and it was great. The rooms were newly renovated and clean. The beds were too firm for our liking but I would take that over some of the other dirty hotels we have seen before. The rooms were very quiet even though the hotel is close to the highway and we were right at the top of the stairs. Ida was very helpful at checkout when there was an issue with the rate. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What an outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: remember48
Reviews.Content: I can't express enough what wondferful, thoughtful and caring staff that works at the Vagaond Inn. They take great pride from the cleaniness of the rooms to the manicure of the hotel gardens. I wanted to have something special for our daughter and son-in-law and Ida and the staff did an outstanding job in making their day special. From the chilled champange, scattered rose pedals to the chocolate strawberries, it was beautiful. This was truly a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.....but very average hotel overall.”
Reviews.Author: Rob909
Reviews.Content: I shopped around quite a bit before I booked here, and honestly I booked because of the reviews here on TripAdvisor. But I don't give it the above average rating it has received by many others. The hotel itself was very average (Motel 6 quality).....nothing spectacular at all. I felt the room was clean and the maid service did a good job. They do seem to be reluctant to give extra towels for some reason though. The one thing that was kind of bothersome were the knats that were in the room when we checked in. I think the maids leave the doors open while cleaning and they enter then with all the trees surrounding the facility. This could easily be fixed with better awareness. Also, the in-room safe did not work. Make sure you get the $2 per day charge removed from your bill if it does not work. It was laready included on my bill and would not have been removed if I had not said anything. Leo, in the office was very helpful and pleasant during our breakfast visits. And the breakfast itself was what I have come to expect.....your basic waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, muffins (weekends only), milk, juice, coffee.....more than adequate. Be aware that parking is VERY limited. If you return late on a weekend night when the hotel is at capacity, you will not find a place to park. This happend to me, and after going into the front office to ask for help I was told to park in the "overflow" lot out back (which looked like a homeless camp), or pay $17 to park next door at the Marriott. I chose to park at the hotel on the end of an aisle that was technically not a parking stall, but did the job and was out of the way. In the morning I saw that others who returned even later than I did had the same problems and some even parked in the landscaped areas. They really need to address the parking problem. With as much as I found myself going downtown for activities there, I think if I were to do it again I would pay a little extra and stay downtown. I just think this place is average at best. I also believe a bit overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, wish I had shopped around a little more”
Reviews.Author: aford87_11
Reviews.Content: Vagabond Inn is nicer than it looks from the outside, offers a quiet comfortable room with a great location and includes a nice free breakfast and very, very friendly staff. Overall I was very happy with the stay. There were a few issues which taken individually wouldn't be a big deal but taken together make me wary of staying here again. First, we were given a smoking room which smelled pretty strong and even included an ash tray, after asking for a non-smoking room. A call to the (again, friendly) front desk revealed we couldn't switch rooms as they were all booked up. It wasn't that noticeable once you got used to it, but when unpacking back home I noticed all our clothes smelled like cigarette smoke. Also, the iron in our room leaked water all over the clothes we tried to iron. We were given one bath towel (after booking the room for two people) which was oddly taken away and not replaced the first time housekeeping came. There were no batteries in our closet safe rendering it useless. Our second night, we encountered a cockroach crawling around the bathroom sink. Pros - Price, location, waffle breakfast, comfortable bed, quiet, friendly staff Cons - Smoky room, towels disappeared, cockroach

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: englishbulldogg
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here, and I must say this stay was more enjoyable than last. Rooms were clean and accomodating to my family. Location was near to all places we planned on going. The staff, again, did a great job. Leo, Ida and Dave know what they are doing!!! This is our place to stay when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: opolismith
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided great hospitality and even better rooms. I had never stayed at a Vagabond before, but now that I see what they are all about I will look for Vagabonds everywhere ever I go. Ida helped our family out alot with directions and the nearby attractions. When we checked out she also showed us this program that they do where if you stay 9 nights you get the 10th night free! Two pools, and many options at breakfast really caught the attention of my little ones, and we will be back next summer! :D

Reviews.Title: “"A very comfortable home away from home."”
Reviews.Author: lynda447
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very friendly and helpful. Very comfortable accomodations. Ida was particularly gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Hannahbears_mom
Reviews.Content: I honestly was NOT looking forward to staying at this hotel while visiting in San Diego...luckily my husband convinced me to stay at this little gem! It is NOT the Hyatt...it is NOT the Marriot...it is NOT the Del. It is an older hotel, that in my opinion, functions perfectly at a clean place to sleep with three children in tow. The breakfast area is extremely smal...no more than 8 people can fit in it at a time and there isn't a place to sit except in your room or at the pool area. BUT, those little inconveniences was not enough to damper a great review of a hotel that is functioning as it should--a little shabby, yes, but clean, the staff is friendly and wonderfully helpful, the grounds are lush and the location is great. We thoroughly had a great time at the hotel, for as little of time as you actually spend at the place you sleep while on vacation! We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for doing things around San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Apb23
Reviews.Content: The service was great. Ida was very helpful. The family enjoyed the hot waffle breakfast. The room was clean and was suitable for our trip to Seaworld, San Diego Zoo, and Old Town San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay - don't let the name fool you!”
Reviews.Author: Manluccias
Reviews.Content: Jayson at the front desk was awesome - very pleasant and helpful. Always had a smile even when he was multi-tasking during busy times! Room was very clean and roomy. Very nice pool and spa. Continental breakfast included fresh-made waffles. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back again”
Reviews.Author: earth46
Reviews.Content: A large group of us (friends and family) recently stayed at the Vagabond for 5 days. We had rooms with a pool view and the rooms were clean and updated. The pool area was so convenient for all of us to meet and relax. Housekeeping was good to work with and Ida, at the front desk, was helpful and friendly. We would highly recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: boyswilltravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego and checked out a few hotels out in the Hotel Circle area. Arrived at the Vagabond and enquired about the price. Was a little above our budget and immediately the manager asked my price-point and agreed. Wow! Had a great room, comfy beds and lots of space. Good free breakfast in lobby each morning. The hotel is right beside a local road leading directly to Hillcrest - perfect if you want to explore the bars and restaurants around there. Can avoid the freeways completely.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pooperscoorer1
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego to celebrate my in-law's 50th wedding anniversary. My father-in-law made all the arrangements. We couldn't have been happier with the Vagabond. It was very clean. The staff was friendly, the pool was nice and warm, and things worked. The grounds are beautifully kept and the breakfast was wonderful. I really appreciate Ida, Rosa, and Pooja who also helped us print our boarding passes the day before our departure. This hotel is a great value for the dollar. It is centrally located and is only minutes from Sea World, the San Diego Zoo, Coronado Beach, and other attractions and restaurants. There are two malls close by and the highways are easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and room great location”
Reviews.Author: anglia48
Reviews.Content: the service we received was great easy check in and helpful when we asked where to eat etc. we had an upstairs room which was large and comfortable. bed was comfortable and ammenities were good. room was always cleaned well, sometimes it was hard to get a park close to the room if we came back late at night. the breakfast was good too. hotel is just across the road from fashion valley shopping centre which had good shops and food options. we had hired a car so it was easy to get to sea world, san diego zoo, and the main town of san diego. very happy with the hotel and would stay again if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: Victoriakm
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the good reviews and it's location. It is only a 5 minute drive to the zoo, and some great restaurants. The check in area has the breakfast area attached but no where to eat so you take it back to your room, which has a table and chairs. The bed was comfy enough, the shower and toilet are in a smaller room and the sink is in an alcove off the main room. We were so happy with the room and what we paid for it. There is ample parking and great wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great economical place to stay with kids. Close to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaRed
Reviews.Content: Close enough to Seaworld to come back for lunch and a swim. Nice little motor inn. 2 pools - 1 heated. Great wifi. Breakfast was too light for us. Waffles no toast. OJ only. quiet until the Memorial Day weekend crowd came in. Park right at door if you're downstairs but you can hear kids in the a.m. if it's busy. Beds were firm but we liked that and they were comfortable. Fridge and microwave. Walking distance to a diner 2 doors down that was fabulous (Valley Kitchen). Nice that you can walk.

Reviews.Title: “Planning an event in SD? Consider the Vagabond Inn.”
Reviews.Author: kamka8
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and am planning a family reunion. The staff at the Vagabond Inn has been extremely helpful in helping to prepare for the event. They quoted very reasonable rates for our group during peak tourist season. They even created a personalized electronic flyer to send to all my guests planning to come to San Diego. The staff graciously gave me a tour of the hotel and I saw several of their rooms. Everything looked clean and quite comfortable. Since I live in the area, I have not actually stayed at the hotel. However, based on my observations of the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms, the friendly and helpful staff, and the many free amenities offered, I have no hesitation recommending the Vagabond Inn to anyone visiting the area. I have confidence that the Vagabond Inn will make my guests feel welcomed and comfortable when they arrive in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Motel”
Reviews.Author: Seeing-America-first
Reviews.Content: If one is looking for a fancy motel with all the trimmings one will not care for this motel. However, as far as I am concerned, it is as good as or better than the fancy motels. It is a beautiful little motel (one can park at the door) in a lovely setting. Every one from the desk to the cleaning staff were great and very helpful. The room was very clean and stayed that way. The wireless internet service, although listed as not secure, is excellent and worked every time. There were no surprises at check out-I was charged exactly what I was quoted per night plus taxes-no hidden fees. The room has a microwave, fridge, ironing board, coffee maker (for-for me, tea) and a safe. I believe there may be a fee if one uses the safe but I did not use it so I can't say. In my opinion the location is great. It is easy on and off of I-8 going east and west. But, then I can get around Hotel Circle and San Diego with no problem. I had no problem getting to Cabrillo National Monument, Mission Bay, Old Town Birch Aquarium, the USS Midway, or Harbor Drive. It isn't that hard but for some one not used to the city it might take some practice but once you know where you are going (and San Diego is not hard to get around in) it is easy from this motel. There are some restaurants in motels near here but I did not try them. That would be the only draw back -lack of near by places to eat. They do have a nice breakfast in the lobby with Belgium Waffles, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, tea, coffee, juice, etc., BUT one needs to bring the tray from the room that the coffee maker is on and take breakfast back to the room. My room was ground floor near the stairs and by the coke and snack machines and it was not noisy. There are two pools, one heated. I paid under $60 a night but it probably is more in the high season in the summer. I drove everyplace I went so I do not know if there is a trolley or bus or shuttle stop near the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rubrown5
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay, hotel seemed a bit older,but very well run. Good sized room with micro,fridge, large separate sink area with big counter for setting stuff, good bed and not too bad pillows. Staff was very friendly. Good location, as we left car there, as there was a bus stop right ouside the doors for one direction, and another one across the street a half a block, depends where you wanted to go. Was 5 dollars ea. for a day pass. Breakfast was sufficient, filled us up just fine, good waffles. LOVED Old Town, would defineately stay here again on a return visit. Has two pools, we used the heated one, as the other one was COLD!

Reviews.Title: “Hot water and Cold Fridge”
Reviews.Author: moosemarine
Reviews.Content: I called around to 12 different hotels looking for a room for 4 nights. I needed a fridge and a microwave. No hotel would give me a room with both without chargeing an outrageous amount of money. I called last minute and got a great room. The room was clean and smelled great. The bed and bathroom were spotless. The carpet had no stains. The water was hot and the fridge was new and cold. I had a great stay and will recomend this hotel to fellow workers and family. Also thanks for the military discount.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & cheap, breakfast was decent.”
Reviews.Author: alishia80
Reviews.Content: I stayed there April 2011 for one night while going out dancing downtown. We got a queen room w/ refrigerator for $69+ tax on a Friday night. Cab fare to downtown SD is $14-$20 depending on how savvy the cabdriver is. Yellowcab seemed better, we took a total of 4 cabs to and from. The first room's heater didn't work and normally wouldn't be an issue, but it was raining and cold this weird Friday in April. Apparently they knew the heater didn't work because our friend had gotten stuck with that room the previous weekend. They pretended it was a surprise and told us the only other room they had that night was 'out of service' because it didn't have a fridge. We were stuck as it was already 8pm so we settled. Turns out they didn't have a remote for that room either. All in all it was clean and the bed was comfortable and made well. They had a waffle breakfast which I didn't take advantage of only saw. Haven't checked the bank account to make sure they charged me correctly yet, but If they didn't I'll be back to post about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back From Our 2nd Stay at the Vagabond-Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: quadmannn
Reviews.Content: To all of the naysayers: c'mon guys, you can't deny that The Vagabond is a GREAT value for the money. Our son has lived in San Diego for 5 years. Periodically we visit. The Vagabond is the 3rd hotel we've tried, and the ONly one we've returned to (that should say everything!). Try finding a cheaper, cleaner alternative in the San Diego area than The Vagabond. It's not going to be an easy task. 4 nights' stay, taxes INCLUDED, came to around $270 ($67.50/night). For this we got: -a decent-sized CLEAN room (unlike the hotel down the street where we previously stayed. -free parking (UNlike a unnamed hotel nearby that charges $16/day to park). -free wireless internet that works well. -a safe in-room -in-room microwave -in-room refrigerator -iron/ironing board; they'll lend you a hair dryer -a very nice comfortable king-size bed. the pillows were nice, too. -a free continental breakfast every morning (fresh fruit, coffee, milk, cereal, wafflemakers) -TV and desk area in-room During our most recent trip, my wife and I stayed in 3 different hotels in Las Vegas and San Diego. The Vagabond had the most comfortable bed. Unlike some of the other reviewers, I slept like a baby, and I am a pretty light sleeper. The location is within walking distance to other hotels in the circle (restaurants), there is a convenience store next door, and you can walk to Fashion Valley Mall in about 10 minutes. I should mention that we had a vehicle at our disposal (my son lent us his truck). The hotels on Hotel Circle are right next to the freeway (I-8). If you are not going to have a vehicle you should probably stay downtown. Other than that, The Vagabond is great. Regretfully, we may never stay at The Vagabond again. Our son has just graduated from UCSD and will be moving on.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Gerintell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels in San Diego, California, but this one was a real disappointment. The AAA price of 59 dollars a night was fantastic, and the help was very friendly and pleasant, but there were some issues I had. First off, the water heater is extremely finicky and often spurts out cold water without warning for a minute or two before returning to it's previous state. On top of this the rooms are fairly small, and not at all what I expected from viewing their images on this website and others. Our room was also extremely noisy as traffic can be heard quite clearly from the room. If I had to describe the level of sound I would say it was almost like the window was open, but I have checked and double checked everything only to find that the gaps in the door are to blame (to which we can do nothing about.) It is easily heard over the television. After finding these issues to be too unpleasant for the price and the vacation I had in mind, I asked if I could either upgrade or cancel my second nights stay, and they informed me that they had no better rooms available, and then denied me the chance to cancel the next day due to their 24 hour cancellation policy. This gesture should speak for the hotel more than I can - they denied me sleep and hot water but they still expect to be paid for the next nights stay. So if you merely need a place to stay the night (not a vacation,) and you have no trouble falling asleep, then look no further - the staff is quite friendly and there is a refrigerator AND microwave in the room... but if you are looking for a vacation, or are a light sleeper, I advise you stay away. It's just not worth it. This was all very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Expensive tastes on a 2011 budget”
Reviews.Author: SmokeyBlack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my new destination of choice when I need to be in San Diego overnight. All I do is call up David who has never let me down. He is friendly, courteous and I really feel he cares whether I have a good night or not . In each room there is a Safe, TV, Microwave, Minifridge, Iron, Ironing Board, Coffemaker w/coffee and bedside clock/radio for getting up on time. There's good lighting and it's nice and quiet through the night for a good nights sleep. Beds are comfortable and the bathroom is always clean. Furniture is well placed and each room regardless of configuration is spacious and well presented. For business or pleasure, with family or solo, The Vagabond Inn is Okie Dokie with me in my book. .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amk54
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel in December. Everything was fine: room, service, location. Very good quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “I liked staying there”
Reviews.Author: lopa16
Reviews.Content: I like customer service of Ida, Rosy and Denai. they were all very helpful, friendly and easy to talk to. I wish best for all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: amtm
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for shopping, you do need a car because of the highway but its a great hotel for the basics! rooms are very clean and staff is great! very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Steph27r
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, kids loved the waffle breakfast. No traffic noise from room and we were close to road. Annoying that every day we had to request more towels - 4 staying in the room and we arrived to find 2 towels - went and got more from reception, same story every day. WiFi worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Snag the Jacuzzi Suite”
Reviews.Author: SportGuy15
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for Tennessee - San Diego game and I thought we would splurge on a Jacuzzi Suite at the Vagabond, which was right next to Qualcomm Stadium. Perfect !!! I got a ton of bonus points from my girl friend. The Vagabond thought of everything - great tub for two, 2 candles, music, bubble bath, etc. All I had to do was smile and say, "Yeah Baby".

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: cutedisneygirly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a Saturday night before visiting the San Diego Zoo the following day. The front desk staff was very friendly and checked us in quickly. We originally booked a single queen room, but they ended up giving us two queens as they were overbooked on the single queens. It was nice to have the extra space. The room was very clean and the beds were pretty comfortable. Not too hard or soft. We could hear noise from the freeway, but the fan helped to block that out. The bathroom was clean, but the showerhead was a bit low. My 6'1" husband did not care for that, and I even had problems even though I am only 5'4". There was plenty of parking, even on a Saturday night when the hotel was completely booked. The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast. We were expecting a larger selection of food than what was offered. They had the waffle makers, some fruit, a few pasteries, cereal, and coffee, milk, and juice. We also had to bring a tray from our room to the breakfast to carry the food back to our room as there was no seating at the breakfast. We could have sat outside next to one of the two pools, but it was raining. We ended up skipping their breakfast and going out. This hotel was nice for a quick place to stop. It was close to a lot of attractions and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly Service, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Patbat79
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in San Diego Hotel Circle. Especially the Service was great. The Man at the Front Desk - Leo - helped us to find various places in San Diego. He took the time to explain everything including which Bus or Trolley to use. After our shopping tour we asked him about pizza delivery and he gave us some numbers and tips where to order. We also ordered some Sea World Tickets online. To print them he asked me to come to the Lobby and he printed them fo me. Absolutley amazing service and the best service I experienced in my 4 weeks in the USA. And i was in much more expansive motels.... The rooms were clean. Cable TV etc all included. Also a refrigerator, a microwave and a coffee machine. Especially the badromm was super clean. All the rooms were pretty new. And donÂ´t forget that the Vagabond Inn got real cheap prices.... ItÂ´s not very loud. Its not in walking distance to Downtown San Diego but Old Town is not too far away. Parking is free.... Ahhh, and the Free-Wifi-Internet is really fast. And thats also the first time that it REALLY was fast....other motels only tell you it would be fast... IÂ´ll definatley come back at my next visit to San Diego... You have to excuse my bad english but IÂ´m german...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, good location!!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge053
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean, staff friendly and the hotel is close to Old Town San Diego. It has a pool and hot tub and even though we did not use there were other hotel guests who did. I gave it a 4 rather than 5 because the continental breakfast was weak: it had mostly high sugar cereal, fruit consisted only of apples and oranges. One could waffles and there was coffee, and milk. To be fair, I had breakfast when they were about to close breakfast. The other reason it seems this hotel is smoker-friendly and most of the time when walking to our room we had to breath smoke. However, we asked for a smoke-free room and it did not smell of tobacco smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Nay to the naysayers!”
Reviews.Author: adamvega
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to recommend a terrific, affordable and clean place to stay if you're in San Diego! I saw some reviews previous to my visit (a few were negative) but felt inclined to find out for myself if the claims were valid. All in all, I had a very good time at the Vagabond. Let's get the negatives over with first: The room was a little cramped and the bathtub drain was a little clogged. Wasn't that easy? I think the Vagabond IS a business hotel, so I guess it's supposed to be a little spartan. If I had been by myself, I wouldn't have minded a bit. However, for two persons, it was a little small. As for the drain -- stuff happens. I loved the continental waffle breakfast. I loved the location! I loved the parking! The customer service was astute and professional. I liked having coffee and an iron and a hairdryer (did have to ask for that!) in the room. Will not only recommend it but will stay there again next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: damo1baker
Reviews.Content: great hotel at a great price, with very professional staff, and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: highmarked
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in August while visiting San Diego. We had a pleasant experience with a clean room that was ready for us when we got there. We had an end room that was on the ground level but heard very little of the interstate which was only a few hundred yards away. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were ok for the price we paid. It was easy to find. The shower was hot and had good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karmill_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for the money. The grounds and pools are very well kept, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the free wi-fi worked great. There is ample free parking and the microwave and fridge were nice to have. The free breakfast isn't huge, but waffles and cereal were fine for us. The location was great -- short drive to SeaWorld, Old Town and Fashion Valley Mall. I don't know if we just got lucky and had good neighbors, but the nights were very quite and peaceful. Yes, the highway is near, but our room was towards the back of the hotel and noise was never an issue. The staff was friendly and helpful, particularly Cristian. Yes, you could pay more somewhere else and get fancier rooms and thicker towels. But if a safe, comfortable, clean room is all you require at the end of a long day of activities, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilyntommy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean,good service and close to our places that we need to go. Close to Sea world and beaches. Staff was welcoming and polite. Plus about this hotel is free parking. We will stay at this hotel in the future. Thanks for your great service

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great location and value added choice for families in the beautiful surrounding area of San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: eyedocjen
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Vagabond Hotel were wonderful. Special thanks to Rose and Leo for their help. Being from so far away, you never know what a hotel is truly like and we were pleasantly surprised for the great service and accomodations for the price. Our children loved the bunk beds and the pools were awesome. The hot waffles were also a huge hit with my family. My only reccommendation would be to provide more seating around the pools for breakfast! The weather is too beautiful to be sitting in the hotel room eating breakfast! Thank you again for everything and we will definately stay again when our travels take us to San Diego once again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION-FABULOUS CLEAN POOL w/ COMFY FURNITURE”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTrvln
Reviews.Content: This Vagabond is different from any other I have seen. The front desk personnel is VERY friendly, quick, and knowledgeable to EVERYTHING in San Diego....all of the other employees are SUPER friendly, and always acknowledge you when your either walking or driving by.... Being that I am from Hawai'i I spend A LOT of time at the pool and I have to say IMPRESSIVE!!!! CLEAN-WELL MAINTAINED and the furniture they have out there....SOOOO COMFY you can fall asleep in an instant. There is always a lil' breeze as you are in Mission Valley...CENTRALY LOCATED TO EVERYTHING..downtown, Sea World, the bay, the beach, shopping...you name it! GREAT PROPERTY, FABULOUS STAFF and OUTSTANDING POOL =)

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, central location, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: mydogsimba1234
Reviews.Content: Good price and comfortable for children. Fun pool and jacuzzi. Ease of breakfast buffet great for kids. Cris at front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: dk4537
Reviews.Content: The front desk folks were very nice. They allowed us to check in early and extended the checkout time. Walking distance to the Fashion Valley Mall and trolley station. The noise from the next door couple was a little loud due to slamming doors, etc. Overall a nice little motel. Continental breakfast with waffles a nice touch. Easy access to freeways and tourist spots. Don't forget Phil's BBQ right up the 8 west @ sports arena.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: ukdiva911
Reviews.Content: we booked a 4 night stay here while on a 3 week road trip.Going by previous reviews I thought this would be a great deal,free parking,internet and breakfast what more could you ask for? we checked in and I was greeted by cockroaches! The bathroom was old and decaying and there was no way I was staying there! That being said when my husband told them that we would not be staying they were very nice about it and we were allowed a full refund. for those of you that arent fussy this would be fine for those that want alittle level of class stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel with reasonable facilities, better to have a car”
Reviews.Author: Hwal
Reviews.Content: Visited this motel at the end of 3-week jaunt across California. We dropped off our car when we arrived, so used public transport, which was OK but not ideal for this Motel. I do realise that almost all visitors had cars, parking at the motel was good and free and it does have easy access to the freeway. I would judge this as a good 3-star establishment, rooms were clean, facilities reasonable - liked the Waffle-maker at breakfast and the hot-tub. In terms of other reviews, I didn't find the staff particularly helpful compared to other hotels visited. Note that the pool(s) were not heated, so a little chilly for a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull staff and decent accomodations for a great price”
Reviews.Author: TimFour
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the "discount" hotels in the area and this is by far my favorite. The rooms are clean and the facilities are VERY well kept. My favorite part about stay has definitely been the staff. Ida, David and Leon have always given me a warm reception and gone out of their way to help me with whatever I needed. This has been my home away from home while traveling to San Diego on business. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Value, BUT no Towels???”
Reviews.Author: englishbulldogg
Reviews.Content: We come to San Diego regularly as this City is one our favorites to come to vacation. Normally we stay downtown, however this time we decided to give Vagabond a try. VAGABOND INN IS THE BEST VALUE WE'VE FOUND IN OUR MANY YEARS OF TRAVELLING!!! Their staff was great. Well trained, a very professional appeal. The rooms were very nice best rates in town. We were pleasantly surprised to see the beautiful, well kept landscaping and very thorough housekeeping. Overall, we had a blast. HOWEVER, I have never been to such a nice property that doesn't supply enough towels for their guests. We called for towels and were informed they did not have any available. After some time, we went to the front desk and they still did not have towels available. Because of this, it diminishes the value of their property, to not be readily available to supply their guests with a simple request such as laundered towels. Hopefully, they can take care of that minor problem so that we can enjoy our stay even better the next time we come back.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: awesomeaarti1234
Reviews.Content: Every year i come down for business with my colleagues. Our company is very cheap so they normally always find nasty old and tacky hotels like dayâ€™s inn or motel 6. So as usual I did not have my hopes high. When i arrived at the hotel I was greeted nicely by the front desk as I enjoyed freshly baked chocolate chip cookies (was a really good touch after not eating in the last hours). I had arrived at 1:00pm (check in was at 2), and next thing I know I was given keys to room with a complimentary early check inn. So like I said my hotel is cheap so I walk in the room and next thing I know Iâ€™m relaxing on my bed while listening to some soothing jazz on the clock radio. Sadly my nap was over when I was awakened by my stupid colleagues who told me to get up because they were going swimming. It was freezing cold outside, but good thing there pool is heated and on top of a heated pool they had a Jacuzzi! The next day I had to wake up at 5:00am for my conference luckily the day before made a wake up call with the front desk. After the conference i came back to snag another cookie and to get an iron. I simply told the front desk my room number and then.......................GUESS WHAT...................... they gave me a free upgrade to their newly renovated Jacuzzi suites!!!!!!!!! I was so excited. The next day I checked out completely relaxed and stressed free. Turns out that same day my boss called me telling me I was getting a raise and I was going to become VP of the company!

Reviews.Title: “good value, good staff, not a peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: ceejay01Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel, along with many more face 16 lanes of traffic, so it is not quiet. The staff were good especially the night manager ( dave? i think) who was excellent, the room was clean and roomy. There is a shuttle bus service to the old town transport terminus if you have no vehicle. Good value for money and great complimentary waffle breakfasts. On a sunday you have to walk to and from the fashion district (awesome shopping - best avoided) for transport (about 12 mins) you need to get yourself to and from the airport about $23

Reviews.Title: “Mon-Thurs is okay but Fri, Sat, Sun don't do it”
Reviews.Author: wannago2
Reviews.Content: I really would like to give this hotel a better review, but I just can't do it. I use Trip Advisor heavily! and for the first time, I feel let down. We had a conference at the Town and Country but we wanted a less expensive hotel within walking distance. Vagabond seemed a good choice. This is an older hotel which has been renovated and the renovation is very nice. I really like their choice of colors. The breakfast buffet is very nice. Wifi is free and parking is free. (Town and Country charges $8 a day for parking!) The front desk staff is also very nice and helpful. However, their clientele is what bothered me. On Friday night we were in a room near the pool but we had just arrived, so we had jet lag and wanted to sleep. The kids running in and out of their rooms and slamming the doors was a problem. So was the highway noise. Then we moved into a room farther back in the complex. That solved the highway noise. But on Sat. night a big brother was wrestling his little brother and slamming him into the walls, doors, and railing all the way down the hallway. Finally on Sun night at 4:30 in the morning behind my head board there was a domestic dispute going on with a man yelling, "I'm going to kill you, you f***ing b**ch." Then Mon-Thurs. was just fine and then on Friday evening the pimp mobiles started showing up in the parking lot again. I just can't recommend this hotel and it's sad because there's nothing wrong with the hotel or any of their services or any of the staff. It was strictly their customers who make me wrinkle my nose when I think about our experience here. Next time I would try a different hotel on Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for the money and the location”
Reviews.Author: DarrinCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vagabond from May 26 to May 29. This was a nice Inn to stay at. It is not a Hotel but it is your average motel. It is a place where it provides your basic needs. It is clean, comfortable (for the price), and is in a great location. It does have microwave and a fridge which is a nice feature to buy and store water or juice. The employees were nice and polite. We had requested extra pillows and we had them within 15 mins. What I really liked about this place is its location. It is walking distance to Fashion Valley Mall and it does not take long to get to Old Town, Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, or Sea World. On the negative side, the motel is showing signs that it needs renovations. Management has down its best to keep the motel well maintained. I am a particular person and I hate staying at poor hotels or motels but I have to say that Vagabond was a pleasant experience. I did not try the complimentry breakfast as we prefered to go to a sit down restaurant (Corner Bakery Cafe is excellent). We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: jennifer111477
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel overnight and was disappointed. Yes, it's cheap, but you would think that they would have maintenance people available 24/7. They don't. They also have incredibly slow internet - it takes about 6 tries to hook up. And then it cuts off while you're in the middle of doing something. Breakfast - homemade waffles - is good, but there's nowhere to eat so you have to take the foot back to your room and it's cold by the time you get there. If you're looking for cheap and clean, this is your place. If you want something extra, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “customer service was awesome”
Reviews.Author: thumper666
Reviews.Content: i called several other hotels in the area and they didn't even come close to the lady i spoke to (alondra). she was very helpful, answered all my questions without hesitation. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning on staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: maresa02
Reviews.Content: We needed a place not far from the airport because we arrived late in the evening and didn't to drive all the way to Fallbrook (our eventual location). I found the Vagabond online and the reviews were good and you couldn't beat the price (online special of just over $50). The staff was professional and helpful, the pillows were good (which is saying a lot because I have a "pillow fetish") and the room was clean. Breakfast the next day was a little awkward because there was no place to eat----a few tables around the outdoor pool was all. So plan to bring breakfast back to your room. And either bring a hair dryer or ask for one at the desk when you check in-----there aren't any in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage20106
Reviews.Content: It's a very quiet, clean and convenience location. Breakfast waffle is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, very clean and accommodating!!”
Reviews.Author: MandA03
Reviews.Content: We stay here all the time in one of the jacuzzi suites. The front desk is always courteous and helpful. The rooms are up to date and the beds are very comfortable. We LOVE this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base camp to explore San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jimmez50
Reviews.Content: What attracted us to this hotel was the availability of "kids suites". this seems to be a fairly new marketing thing, but a good one. What this place does is include a nice bunk bed (twin on top, full below) in the room with a std queen. My two teenage daughters absolutely will not sleep in the same bed anymore. Our option has been large (and expensive) suites to this point, so, this option seemed like a good alternative. The kids suite worked out perfectly. No fights... The room is average size, nothing special. Very clean... Well maintained, older fixtures, plenty of hot water. Appeared to have new wall unit AC. big mini fridge, DVD player, 32" TV, Microwave, room safe, Nicely kept landscaping etc. Attentive staff in the office. Clean heated (8 ft !) pools and hot tub... Make no mistake, this is after all, a motor hotel... doors on outside facing parking lot etc. However, if you are there to sleep and see the sights, it is just fine. Metros and other trendy folk will not be happy with this hotel. Look towards Balboa Park for the hip neighborhoods... However, if you have kids and you plan to be spending all your time at Sea World, the Zoos, Legoland etc. its tough to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and clean”
Reviews.Author: saboody
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with the Vagabond Inn. I really wasn't sure what it was going to be like for the price but it met every one of my expectations and I was completely safe, comfortable, it was clean, peaceful and serene. Thanks for a wonderful stay and a great breakfast. Whenever I'm in San Diego this is my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Super Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RTD1954
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond location is only 10 minutes away from all the major sights and Hillcrest Shopping Area (take the shortcut on Bachman Drive). A short five minute walk to a mall and there are many places to eat in nearby hotels and other chain restaurants. Front desk personel are excellent - quick, courteous and helpful (Ida was super friendly and very helpful.). There is a free breakfast with make it yourself waffles, coffee, juice, cereal and sometimes muffins. Cookies arrive around three o'clock for an afternoon snack. There is a heated pool that was open and being used even in March and a hot tub that was very nice after a long day of walking. Someone mentioned a second unheated pool but I never noticed it. We had great wireless connection, though they seemed to change the router protocols midway through the stay and the newer version seems to require reconnecting and signing in more often than the other. Maid service was very good and we always found new towels and toiletries each day. Overall it was a great stay and I will have no trouble recomending people to stay here when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: kittysd
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous, the room was clean, and the decor was modern (you could tell the hotel and recently been under rennovations to improve it's excellence). After driving aimlessly through hotel circle I was very pleased that i had chosen Vagabond Inn to stay at. it was a pleasant experience and I would certainly reccommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: CRBug
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean room. Well maintained grounds. Can't say anything about pools, it was too cool when we were there. Only $55 a night for a room with a king bed. Cons: Wireless internet did not work in room. We were told "the company is coming tomorrow to update the system. We can put you in a room next to the laundry and try it there" Are they joking? Noise: Okay, you are next to a major freeway. The air conditioner/vent unit drowned out the sound of the freeway. I agree with another reviewer - watch the safe charge. Other places I have stayed have made it an option up front. The fact that this company puts it on your bill and you have to catch it seems very underhanded. Breakfast: Okay, so if a cup of coffee gets you going in the morning this is okay. To us, a waffle is not going to hold you for a day of sightseeing. We walked to the Valley Kitchen Restaurant instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: googoo4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located for our Concert at Copley Hall, downtown. It also accepted our pet (dog) for an additional $20. Still the total for the night was under $100. Coffee was always available at the office as were Otis Spunkmeyer cookies. They offered a hot waffle and cereal for free at breakfast. The room was adequate with 2 queens. The shower spray was weak. Free wired or wireless internet was included. All in all a good value for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: karmannghia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights for a nearby convention. The room was clean, staff was friendly, and included a free breakfast. Loved that there was a mini fridge & micro and free parking. Very close to freeway, but the noise didn't ever bother us much. I would stay here again when visiting the San Diego area. We got a great rate as compaired to the other nearby properties.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Be Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ProPetSitter210
Reviews.Content: Great value for your buck! I was worried about the motel's cleanliness & safety when I booked since I got a cheap rate, but it's a genuinely nice deal! Friendly staff and, best of all, the room was clean. In fact, I happened to sneak a peek inside a room on my way to check-out and noticed housekeeping actually changing the sheets. Hey, it's a big deal if you've heard some of the horror stories out there. WiFi worked great once you call the front desk for the code. Bus stop right out front (Route 88) and there's always a taxi nearby since it's a strip full of hotels/motels. My room was about four doors down from the front desk so I felt safe. It was quiet at night. Great location, too. I would definitely stay again if I'm ever in San Diego. By the way, I love SD!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice I could have made”
Reviews.Author: Querida_Ge
Reviews.Content: Since September 2009 I've been required to stay once a week in San Diego in the Mission Valley neighborhood. I tried a couple of hotels in the area before I settled for the Vagabond Inn Hotel Circle, and intend to stick to it. The rooms have been nicely remodeled not long ago, are well equipped with very useful mini-fridge, microwave oven, coffee maker and safe. I really like to work using the desk by the window in the king bedroom I usually stay in. The staff has accommodated all of my requests so far, and I love the waffles in the morning. I can even work by the pool in the back, the setting is really nice. This hotel is a great deal and great place to stay. I strongly recommend it. I'd also stay there if I go back with my family for a leisure trip. Well done, hotel team!

Reviews.Title: “Superior for Cleanliness, Hospitality, Service and Pet-Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RobFinter
Reviews.Content: I had to spend over 3 weeks with my 2 adult german shepherds at the Vagabond Inn on Hotel Circle. The rooms are updated, clean, and the grounds, 2 pools & hot tub are spotless. The staff is incredible. Better stay than any I've had at a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Placed Hotel With Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: bb28am
Reviews.Content: Arrived late after long haul flight so pleasantly suprised with comfortable room and a friendly welcome. Hotel ideally placed for all local things to see such as Balboa Park and Coronado but a car as with much of the US is essential. Breakfast good but repetitive, stay away from the cafe near the Days inn and head for the Fashion Valley Mall only five mins walk or two by car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GregB99
Reviews.Content: Nice place and I enjoyed my stay. Rooms where very clean. Only problem was with the TV remote and I had no hot water on Tuesday morning Oct 6 of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe and clean.”
Reviews.Author: strongforward
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean. The remote control was temperamental. I would stay there again. The price could be less.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel61791
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Vagabond Inn was so great! The workers were very polite and well dressed. The room was very clean and organized, and I will definitely be returning to this hotel for future stays. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay at an affordable price. I was very satisfied with my whole stay. It was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: sporknotfoon
Reviews.Content: Pluses: - Let me check-in early (10:30am) - Waffle continental breakfast - Great service/staff - 2 good-sized pools - In-room amenities (mini-fridge, microwave, coffeemaker) - Great location, close to freeway on/off-ramps Minuses: - Non-smoking room reaked of smoke and as I walked in, my neighbors were smoking in their non-smoking room with (at least) the door open - Walls/floors are paper thin - Sub-par bed & bath linens (even for a motel) - Free Wi-Fi was bogged down and slower than my old 56k modem used to be Overall: Given all the competition around, I'd assume I'd be getting more bang for my buck. I expect the sub-par motel experience at a monopoly in a small town - not amidst 40 other hotels and motels in a big city. I found myself wondering how much better the other motels around me as I came and went. Not a good feeling!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, lots of extras for no extra cost”
Reviews.Author: docentksb
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Vagabond. Both stays have been better than you would expect for the low price tag for a clean room with lots of extras that are included: free wifi, mini fridge with freezer and microwave, safe big enough to fit a laptop, coffee in room, free waffle breakfast in the mornings, two pools to chose from and a hot tub, plus more. Location is excellent to get to all the San Diego attractions and downtown plus tons of shopping/dining within one highway exit for anything you might need. We ended up extending our trip and extra day and they couldn't have been more helpful with arrangements and pricing. We also have a 9 1/2 month old baby, everyone was really nice to us and made us feel really welcome. We're tough critics and have stayed all over the country at high end and low end hotels. We really like this Vagabond and highly highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “HOagy's Heroes thank Vagabond Inn”
Reviews.Author: britbigduck
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond is a great place to stay. I stayed at the Vagabond as one of a group of charity riders ... Hoagy's Heroes who were riding from San Diego to Jacksonville to benefit the children of veterans. The rooms were excellent and very clean with comfortable beds.
